abstract: Louisiana State University survey finds almost four out of five white residents of New Orleans say city has mostly recovered from Hurricane Katrina, while almost three out of five blacks assert otherwise, with more than one-third saying post-Katrina quality of life in New Orleans is worse.
lead_paragraph: A survey found a stark divide among black and white residents over the local economy, the state of schools and the quality of life 10 years after Hurricane Katrina.

headline.main: Racially Disparate Views of New Orleans’s Recovery After Hurricane Katrina
headline.print_headline: Survey Finds Racially Disparate Views of New Orleans’s Recovery After Hurricane

snippet: A survey found a stark divide among black and white residents over the local economy, the state of schools and the quality of life 10 years after Hurricane Katrina.
